Coffee cercospora leaf spot: Plant resistant varieties (e.g., Catimor, Sarchimor), maintain shade regulation (40–50%), prune for open canopy and airflow, apply copper-based fungicides or triazoles preventively during wet seasons, remove and burn fallen leaves, balance fertilization (avoid excess nitrogen).
Coffee healthy: Continue optimal shade (40–50%), regular pruning for ventilation, balanced NPK + micronutrients, mulch to conserve moisture, monitor weekly during rainy season, remove weeds and fallen leaves, avoid overhead irrigation.
Coffee red spider mite: Maintain adequate shade and humidity, avoid moisture stress, spray water forcefully on undersides of leaves, apply horticultural oil or neem every 7–10 days during dry periods, release predatory mites (Phytoseiulus persimilis) if available, avoid broad-spectrum insecticides.
Coffee rust: Plant rust-resistant varieties (Catimor, Castillo, Sarchimor), regulate shade to 30–50%, prune regularly for maximum airflow, apply copper-based fungicides (copper hydroxide, copper oxychloride) on 21–30 day schedule during rainy season, remove and destroy heavily infected leaves, rejuvenate old plantations.
